text: Futurice <3 Cloud! We are looking for people in the various cloud and DevOps roles to join our new Cloud initiative.

We are looking for a Cloud Engineer with a passion for automating manual operations work. In this role you get to utilize the best practices from DevOps and Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) ways of working and you automate work as much as possible. Based on your wishes and client needs, your daily work can be automating operations or supporting development teams or both. You work closely with your team of developers and DevOps engineers plus with the client's development teams. You can work from Tampere or Helsinki.
Together with the team, you
solve the client's operations problems with code, automation and processes.
responsible for ensuring that the platforms, systems, and services you maintain run without problems.
create new and continuously improve both the systems and practices to ensure that the amount of manual work needed for operations is ever decreasing.
work closely with the client's development teams and make sure that they have high efficiency, autonomy and that their daily work runs smoothly in a cloud environment.
The Cloud team is new so you have a great opportunity to build the offering and ways of working with us.
Who are we looking for?
Some experience of one or more of these listed topics help you to thrive as the Futurice’s next Cloud Engineer:
technical understanding of public clouds, like AWS, Azure or GCP
hands-on experience of operations in production, with a knack for improving reliability and scalability
modern infrastructure-as-a-code
minimizing the manual work via automation
monitoring, alerting, and observability toolchain
agile methodology

You join a team so people and communication skills in English are needed. We consider as a plus developer background and practical SRE experience or know-how about SRE core concepts. It is also worth mentioning if you have experience in cloud networking and security, Kubernetes, scripting and tooling.
We offer you
During your journey at Futurice we offer you
Talented team to mentor and do sparring with
Support to your professional growth and have opportunity to learning tracks such as Account Lead, Scrum master or Architect just to name a few
Tools for your needs
Futurice’s unique culture
company benefits such as insurances, healthcare, lunch card, culture and sport benefit, FutuHike, Camps etc
Interested?
If you think that you are our next team member, send your application by Wednesday 4th of May and tell us how you would want to learn and grow with us.
For additional details, contact Petteri Jalonen (+358400433581, petteri.jalonen@futurice.com). Please hold the calls during weekends.

_values.text: Do you hate repetitive work and think “if it can be documented, it can be automated”?  Do you know how to design and implement continuous integration/delivery pipelines that make application developers smile every time they use git push? Are you looking to work in a software development team with an emphasis on infrastructure and automation? Our award-winning tech community is looking for a (Cloud) DevOps engineer to join our office in Tampere. Make sure that cloud infrastructure is well designed and all automation is in place Your daily tasks include:  Working in a software development team with a focus on DevOps work including automating infrastructure, developing tools for application developers and helping application developers with DevOps related work Making sure that automation, monitoring and all associated processes are providing the best possible feedback and ROI to all stakeholders Being a pillar of professionalism who ensures that automation, metrics, logs etc. are easily accessible, especially when the project is handed over For two decades, we’ve been developing qualities and capabilities for adapting, reacting, and supporting change – building Reaktor to hold up in a fast-paced environment while ensuring the well-being of our people. Capable of making sure that the software development process is smooth as silk To thrive in this position, you’ll need:  To be able to script with at least one programming language (Python, Perl, Ruby, etc.) Knowledge of at least some DevOps tools (Terraform, Jenkins, Ansible, Salt, etc.) Experience in setting up automation pipelines in software development teams Experience with at least one cloud provider (AWS, Azure, GCP etc.) Interest and/or experience in agile software development and teamwork Why join us? For two decades, we’ve been developing qualities and capabilities for adapting, reacting, and supporting change – building Reaktor to hold up in a fast-paced environment while ensuring the well-being of our people. While working at Reaktor, we’ll provide you with:  The freedom to impact how you work. Your team chooses the approach, technologies, and methodologies you think will work best in any given situation. A community with as much support as your heart desires A team that’s not only experienced but considerate as well. Your coworkers are likely as experienced as you are, and they all want you to succeed. A sustainable work-life balance and support for your daily life outside of work (free moving day, moving van & other cars to loan for free, sick child care services, office space to use for your private events, etc.). An opportunity to grow as a professional. We offer +35 internal training events on average every month, +15 community events and several 15-minute coffee breaks to discuss hot topics in tech and design. A possibility to take part in longer academy-like studies like leading a team, delivering challenging projects, Cloud Academy, Mobile Academy, GraphQL Academy, UX Academy, and much more. 300+ hobby clubs from winter swimming and running to knitting and archery that bring people together outside (and sometimes inside) of office hours. Many of these are supported by Reaktor. In addition to our culture perks, we’re offering you an extensive benefit package including the following and more: Extended healthcare services, with broad-spectrum specialist services included Dental care up to 250€/year 300€/year for exercise and relaxation 200€/month lunch benefit on top of your salary Travel and health insurance Company shares Bicycle benefit and commuting benefits Subsidized massages A phone of your choice with a phone subscription Internet subscription of your choice State-of-the-art working equipment you pick yourself A programme to support  Open Source work Freedom to work remotely wherever in Finland full-time, or work up to two months from another EU country Support for possible relocations and help to acquire a residence permit if needed Interested? Drop us a line via the form below and introduce yourself. P.S. Listen to our podcast  . The second season is out now.

text: Futurice <3 Cloud! We are looking for people in the various cloud and DevOps roles!

We are looking for experienced Cloud Consultants or Cloud Solution Architects to join our new Cloud initiative. We welcome applicants with different backgrounds to work in the Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team. Your work might consist of 50-50% of internal work and working with clients, adjustable by the need and your wishes. You can work from Tampere or Helsinki.
Depending on the clients’ needs and your personal preferences you get to
Work as a project lead for migration, SRE or cloud ops projects
Who are we looking for?

As you will be working with a new managed services business, you should have understanding and the passion for operations. Especially, how to help enterprises to take advantage of agile, DevOps and SRE methods not only in digital service development but also in operations and thus ensure that all the business, IT and developers would be happy.

We see that many career journeys will be suitable for this role. So you can have Cloud specialist experience with proficiency in some clouds. Or you can have business understanding with a twist of a broader knowledge in the cloud.

You join a team so people and communication skills in English are needed. We consider as a plus know-how about SRE core concepts and production operations, either hands-on or with a broader perspective. It is also worth mentioning if you have experience in multi-cloud management, working in an enterprise environment on a broader scope than just one project or team or if you have experience of changing development and operations culture in a bigger company. It is worth mentioning experience in Kubernetes, security, compliance, cloud landing zones and governance
We offer you
During your journey at Futurice we offer you
If you get good vibes after reading this, we would love to hear from you!
If you are ready to see how far you can really go, send us your application by Wednesday 4th of May and tell us how you would want to learn and grow with us.
For additional details, contact Petteri Jalonen (+358400433581, petteri.jalonen@futurice.com). Please hold the calls during weekends.

Futurice <3 Cloud! We are looking for people in the various cloud and DevOps roles to join our new Cloud initiative.

We are looking for a DevOps Engineer with a passion for improving the developer experience. In this role you get to utilize the best practices from DevOps and Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) ways of working and you automate work as much as possible. Based on your wishes and client needs, your daily work can be automating operations or supporting development teams or both. You work closely with your team of developers and DevOps engineers plus with the client's development teams. You can work from Tampere or Helsinki.
As a team, you
build and maintain the client's cloud infrastructure and tools to support and accelerate development teams.
support development teams to build available, reliable, secure, and scalable services and speed up the process from idea to production.
make sure that the development teams have high autonomy and their daily work runs smoothly in a cloud environment.
solve the operations problems with code and automation and aim to continuously decrease the manual work needed ("toil") for the operations.
The Cloud team is new so you have a great opportunity to build the offering and ways of working with us.
Who are we looking for?
Some experience of one or more of these listed topics help you to thrive as the Futurice’s next DevOps Engineer:
technical understanding of public clouds, like AWS, Azure or GCP
CI/CD pipelines and modern infrastructure-as-a-code
containers and container orchestration
supporting and accelerating development and improving the developer experience
core DevOps concepts
agile methodology

You join a team so people and communication skills in English are needed. We consider as a plus developer background and practical SRE experience or know-how about SRE core concepts. It is also worth mentioning if you have experience in cloud networking and security, Kubernetes, scripting and tooling.
We offer you
During your journey at Futurice we offer you
Talented team to work and mentor if needed
Support to your professional growth and you get opportunities to learning tracks such as Account Lead, Scrum master or Architect just to name a few
Tools for your needs
Futurice’s unique culture
company benefits such as insurances, healthcare, lunch card, culture and sport benefit, FutuHike, Camps etc
Interested?
If you think that you are our next team member, send your application by Wednesday 4th of May and tell us how you would want to learn and grow with us.
For additional details, contact Petteri Jalonen (+358400433581, petteri.jalonen@futurice.com). Please hold the calls during weekends.

_values.text:
Looking for a work environment that gives you the freedom to experiment and grow? 
 Interested in designing next-level digital products and services? 
 Want to be part of a truly diverse team coming from 22 countries? Lets talk 👋 We are looking for an  to join an award-winning team of business analysts, designers and developers. You will be developing the behavior of interactive products and services from the concept level to particular micro-interactions. Your role will cover establishing trusting relationships with our global clients like  adidas ,  HBO ,  Liverpool FC ,  KLM  &  Rovio  to solve complex challenges and human problems with noteworthy design. Establish the guidelines that shape the ways users interact with digital products and services. Work in a multidisciplinary team of designers, business analysts, copywriters, front and backend developers. Collaborate with the clients to make sense of their business challenges, goals and restrains and turn your understanding into great interaction designs. Communicating your ideas to different stakeholders through meaningful narratives will often be part of your day-to-day too. Document detailed research, user flows and analytics to find weak spots or identify opportunities to improve them.  Validate your ideas and concepts with end users. Create concepts and detailed applications (ecosystem maps, customer journeys, service blueprints) based on the user research, benchmarking and design thinking.  Produce and test interactive prototypes while prioritizing MVPs. Have 4+ of experience designing all things digital on top of a challenge-solver mindset who is excited about bringing creative ideas to life. Can show off your skills, talent and vision with a stellar portfolio. Enjoy and have a good eye for crafting killer decks that communicate your ideas and leave no stakeholder in doubt. Have all the soft skills to build long-term relationships of trust with the client. Sometimes you  can be involved in organizing processes (keywords: Kanban, Agile, Lean, Scrum), as well as adopting new methodologies on the spot if they seem to provide for the best outcome.  Are familiar with design and prototyping tools (Figma, Sketch, Adobe or other). Show a great grasp of applying user centric design approach across a range of project types. 
 There is no status quo. You will join a dynamic team granting you a lot of freedom to experiment, innovate and create. We enjoy Reaktor’s flat hierarchy and make sure everyone’s voice is heard. We see people as our main value: being surrounded by a diverse and talented group creates the best environment to learn and grow. Our  Amsterdam office  has a unique vibe being a lively mix of 50+ people coming from 22 different countries: we love to connect, enjoy team activities and learn from failure and embrace success together. € 45 000 – 65 000 a year Flexible working hours Work trips between EU offices Team activities and get-togethers Compensation of self-development activities (courses, conferences, certifications, etc.) The latest computer and phone of your choice Extended health insurance  Screens, keyboard, headphones and the gear you need to make great work An ergonomic home office if needed Healthy and not-so-healthy snacks and drinks at the office Travel expenses  Phone subscription Home internet expenses coverage Company trips (when the pandemic situation permits) If you’re not based in Amsterdam, no worries. What’s important is that you’d be willing to come join us. To make sure we’re a home for top talent like you, we offer a nice  relocation package , as well as all the help and advice you need in moving over.  We are nowhere near the finish line but we are fully committed to taking the journey towards a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace.  
 We are looking to hire, train, compensate and promote people from all backgrounds and walks of life fairly and equally to build the digital future together. You can take a look at Reaktor’s initiatives and actions  here  and check out Reaktorians’ thoughts on how the tech industry could  be a better ally to women . 👋🏽 We’ll start with a brief video chat, just to say hi. Hi! 
 🗣 Then we’ll get to know you a bit better in our Attitude interview. We’ll talk about your past experiences and try to understand how you’d fit in the team. 
 💻 Next up is our Skills interview. 
 💯 Lastly, a chat to discuss some practicalities and make you an offer we hope you can’t refuse. So,  dear future colleague , we can’t wait to hear from you! Apply below👇🏽

Excited about solving human-related matters within a people-first organization? Curious about applying your HR management talents to an office of 500+ people? At Reaktor, we help forward-thinking companies (Adidas, Lego, HBO, Finavia, Liverpool FC, and others) succeed in technology. Our culture defines our key principle: offering exceptional technological competence while deeply caring about the wellbeing of our team-mates. Our Helsinki office is looking for a  who will become a member of our five-person team called “The Hug”. As a Reaktorian, you will be proactively tackling HR challenges, balancing them with our business needs and working closely with our Reaktor community. Have around 5 years of full-time work experience in HR Have experience working with a wide variety of HR-related matters, meaning you can handle both delicate HR conversations and detailed administrative work during the same day or week Have experience and understanding of Finnish employment contracts and labour laws. No compulsory degrees or certs required – a demonstrated history is equally valuable to us Possess strong English language skills – our working language is often English but we also have Finland-specific HR tasks to carry out. Fluent Finnish is considered a plus but not a must-have. Have taken part in HR development initiatives in cooperation with internal and/or external stakeholders We are looking for a team player who is able to support our people with a warm but determined mindset. Whether you are working on onboarding, having discussions about your colleague’s well-being or supporting your colleague in finding a role that best matches them, you are actively looking for the best solution for both the person and the company.  Ideally, you have experience with different kinds of difficult conversations, and you are able to use your emotional intelligence to ensure that the message is presented with a lot of empathy, while also keeping our business needs close to mind. We offer everything you’d expect of an international tech company: interesting challenges, competitive salary and an opportunity to engage with Reaktor offices around the globe. But what really makes us different is our culture — expect great attention to the work-life balance with a possibility to work flexible hours; high levels of trust and autonomy; and a friendly team of interesting, whole personalities willing to connect beyond work. Your closest stakeholders are all of our employees and you will work closely with our current five-person Hug team. Your team is there to support and help you grow, and equally we’re excited to learn from you and your past experiences! In addition to our culture perks, we’re offering you an extensive benefit package including the following and more: Extended healthcare services, with specialist services included Dental care up to 250€/year 300€/year for exercise and relaxation 200€/month lunch benefit on top of your salary Travel and health insurance Possibility to subscribe for company shares Bicycle benefit and commuting benefits Subsidized massages A phone of your choice with a phone subscription Internet subscription of your choice State-of-the-art working equipment you pick yourself Support for possible relocations and help to acquire a residence permit if needed In your application we would love to see you describe some  of your previous projects or initiatives towards employee  wellbeing. What aspects did you take into consideration before moving forward with the initiative? Who did you involve in the process? We are eager to receive your CV and cover letter no later than 21st of March. Hope to hear from you soon! <3

Interested in tackling challenges across different business domains while utilizing the latest front-end technologies? 
 Eager to work in a team where best practices such as automated testing, continuous delivery, and functional programming are the starting point, not the goal? 
Curious to find out what working in a managerless environment feels like? Good, keep on reading! About the job Our  Amsterdam office  is looking for a Front-end Engineer to solve juicy digital challenges at scale, share expertise with others, and work closely with Reaktor communities in Lisbon, Stockholm, Helsinki, NYC and Tokyo. We enjoy working on-site and spending time with our team, but want to offer you opportunity for remote work whenever you wish, support your home office set-up and provide a remote-friendly working environment.  Write complex software from scratch with functional JavaScript/TypeScript utilizing the latest libraries Take care of both the technical and human side of projects Are familiar with React / Vue, automated testing & deployment Dabble outside of the browser every now and then (e.g. setup simple CI pipelines) Scribble a small humble piece of HTML sprinkled with JavaScript hosted on Netlify when it’s the simplest thing that gets the job done 😉 We would like to see 4+ years of experience in Front-end (or experience in all of the above).  Look forward to taking an active part in shaping your team’s ways of working and programming practices. Enjoy working with juniors and seniors on the shiny and dirty bits of the codebase. Ivory Tower Architects need not apply. View your colleagues and clients as individuals with their respective strengths and weaknesses. Believe that sometimes tech is best solved with no code at all, but by talking to the right people. About Reaktor Working in teams and helping clients is our bread and butter. Reaktor’s cross functional teams consist of Front-end Engineers, Backend / DevOps & SRE specialists, Designers, Data Scientists, and Coaches. We unite our efforts to help future-thinking companies like  adidas ,  Lego ,  HBO ,  Finavia , and  FC Liverpool  succeed in their world-scale digital endeavours everyday.  We are nowhere near the finish line but we are fully committed to taking the journey towards a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace. Providing the most empathetic, safe and supportive experience to every Reaktorian is one of our core values. As well as making the world around us a better place one step at a time.   We are looking to hire, train, compensate and promote people from all backgrounds and walks of life fairly and equally to build the future of technology together. Reaktor respectfully encourages applicants of all genders, gender identities and gender expressions, races, religions, ethnicities, countries of origin, age groups, sexual orientations, marital and parental statuses, people with mental or physical disabilities. You can take a look at  Reaktor’s initiatives and actions  here  and check out Reaktorians’ thoughts on how the  tech industry could be a better ally to women .  Process Sounds like you? We need to meet! 💻 We’ll start with a brief video chat, just to say hi. Hi! 👋🏽 Then we’ll get to know you a bit better. We call this the Attitude interview. 😎 Next up is a technical interview. Tech interviews are cringy, we get it. We try our darndest to be as real world as possible. No brain teasers, or sorting algos here! 📃 Finally, the closing interview. Here we discuss practicalities and make you an offer we hope you can’t refuse. ❤️ You’re in! So,  dear future colleague , we can’t wait to hear from you! Apply below👇🏽 : €45,000 – €70,000 per year Reaktor Amsterdam office has a unique vibe, being a lively mix of 22 nationalities. We offer   to those who decide to join our team from outside of the Netherlands.

Are you looking for a work space that gives you the freedom to experiment and grow? 
 Interested in designing great products and services that take our clients’ digital experience to the next level? 
 Want to be part of a truly diverse team coming from 22 countries and a variety of professional backgrounds? Lets talk 👋 We are looking for an  to join an award-winning team of business analysts, designers and developers. You will produce user-centric digital products and services that show great visual taste and bring about empathy and connection. You will be establishing trusting relationships with our global clients like  adidas ,  HBO ,  Liverpool FC ,  KLM  &  Rovio  to solve complex challenges and human problems with noteworthy design.  
 Manoeuvre between brand objectives, user needs and business challenges to create world class experiences. Participate in all steps of the design process from coming up with the concept to communicating it to the client to delivering results. Produce impactful user strategy based on design thinking, user research and hypothesis testing. Make sense of our clients’ business challenges and turn your understanding into great designs. Document detailed research, user flows and analytics to find weak spots or identify opportunities to improve them.  Validate your ideas and concepts with end users. Work in a multidisciplinary team of designers, stakeholder, business analysts, copywriters, front and backend developers across a variety of business verticals from healthcare to aviation to retail.  Have 4+ of experience designing all things digital on top of a challenge-solver mindset who is excited about bringing creative ideas to life. Can show off your skills, talent and vision with a stellar portfolio. Show a great grasp of applying user centric design approach across a range of project types. Have experience working with UX research methodologies and can apply them when necessary. Can develop the required deliverables ranging from information architecture and ecosystem maps, mapping out personas and user journeys, blueprints and prototypes. Enjoy and have a good eye for crafting killer decks that communicate your ideas and convince the client. Are ready to organize processes both with the client and within the team (keywords: Kanban, Agile, Lean, Scrum), as well as adopt new methodologies on the spot if they seem to provide for the best outcome.  Being familiar with Figma, Sketch, Adobe is a plus. There is no status quo. You will join a dynamic team granting you a lot of freedom to experiment, innovate and create. We enjoy Reaktor’s flat hierarchy and make sure everyone’s voice is heard. We see people as our main value: being surrounded by a diverse and talented group creates the best environment to learn and grow. Our  Amsterdam office  has a unique culture being a lively mix of 50+ people coming from 22 different countries: we love to connect, enjoy team activities and learn from failure and embrace success together. € 45 000 – 65 000 a year Flexible working hours Work trips between EU offices Team activities and get-togethers Compensation of self-development activities (courses, conferences, certifications, etc.) The latest computer and phone of your choice Extended health insurance  Screens, keyboard, headphones and the gear you need to make great work An ergonomic home office if needed Healthy and not-so-healthy snacks and drinks at the office Travel expenses  Phone subscription Home internet expenses coverage Company trips (when the pandemic situation permits) If you’re not based in Amsterdam, no worries. What’s important is that you’d be willing to come join us. To make sure we’re a home for top talent like you, we offer a nice  relocation package , as well as all the help and advice you need in moving over.  We are nowhere near the finish line but we are fully committed to taking the journey towards a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace.  
 We are looking to hire, train, compensate and promote people from all backgrounds and walks of life fairly and equally to build the digital future together. You can take a look at Reaktor’s initiatives and actions  here  and check out Reaktorians’ thoughts on how the tech industry could  be a better ally to women . 👋🏽 We’ll start with a brief video chat, just to say hi. Hi! 
 🗣 Then we’ll get to know you a bit better in our Attitude interview. We’ll talk about your past experiences and try to understand how you’d fit in the team. 
 💻 Next up is our Skills interview. 
 💯 Lastly, a chat to discuss some practicalities and make you an offer we hope you can’t refuse. So,  dear future colleague , we can’t wait to hear from you! Apply below👇🏽

Excited about using the latest web technologies? Interested in solving human problems with a holistic approach? Curious to experience a managerless work environment? Look at you sounding like a Reaktorian already 😎 About you We are looking for a Full-stack Developer to join our Tampere office  and solve juicy digital challenges at scale, share expertise with others, and work closely with Reaktor communities in Amsterdam, Lisbon, NYC and Tokyo. Have 3+ years of professional web development experience. Write software from scratch with TypeScript and React. Take care of both the technical and human side of projects. Are familiar with automated testing & functional programming. Enjoy working with juniors and seniors on both the shiny and dirty bits of your repo. Can create new backend services and tweak CI/CD pipelines when needed. Look forward to taking an active part in shaping your team’s ways of working and programming practices. View your colleagues and clients as individuals with their respective strengths and weaknesses. Believe that sometimes tech is best solved with no code at all, but by talking to the right people. Live in Tampere or within a comfortable commute range to be able to work from our beautiful office every now and then. About Reaktor Working in teams and helping clients is our bread and butter. Reaktor’s cross functional teams consist of Front-end Engineers, Backend / DevOps & SRE specialists, Designers, Data Scientists, and Coaches. We unite our efforts to help future-thinking companies like  adidas ,  Lego ,  HBO ,  Finavia , and  FC Liverpool  succeed in their world-scale digital endeavours everyday.  We enjoy working on-site and spending time together, but want to offer you an opportunity for remote work whenever you wish, support your home office set-up and provide a remote-friendly working environment. Benefits We offer everything you’d expect of an international tech company: interesting projects, competitive salary and an opportunity to go on work stays to Reaktor offices around the globe. But what really makes us different is our community & culture — expect great attention to the work-life balance, high levels of trust and autonomy; and a friendly team of interesting personalities willing to connect beyond work. Flexible working hours Work trips between EU offices and possibilities for relocation to all of our offices Team activities and get-togethers Compensation of self-development activities (courses, conferences, certifications, etc.) Get paid to do Open Source work Company shares The latest computer and phone of your choice Extended health services and health insurance  Screens, keyboard, headphones An ergonomic home office if needed Healthy and not-so-healthy snacks and drinks at the office Travel expenses  Phone subscription Home internet expenses coverage Company trips twice a year (when the pandemic situation permits) And lot more in our ever developing perks and benefits stack Come as you are We are nowhere near the finish line but we are fully committed to taking the journey towards a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace. Providing the most empathetic, safe and supportive experience to every Reaktorian is one of our core values. As well as making the world around us a better place one step at a time. We are looking to hire, train, compensate and promote people from all backgrounds and walks of life fairly and equally to build the future of technology together. Reaktor respectfully encourages applicants of all genders, gender identities and gender expressions, races, religions, ethnicities, countries of origin, age groups, sexual orientations, marital and parental statuses, people with mental or physical disabilities. You can take a look at Reaktor’s initiatives and actions  here  and check out Reaktorians’ thoughts on how the tech industry could  be a better ally to women . Interview Process 👋🏽 We’ll start with a brief chat, just to say hi. Hi! 🗣 Then we’ll get to know you a bit better in our Attitude interview. We’ll talk about your past experiences and try to understand how you’d fit in the team. 💻 Next up is our Technical interview. We know, tech interviews can be cringy. But we’ll try our best to be as real-world as possible; no sorting algos here! 💯 Lastly, a chat to discuss some practicalities and make you an offer we hope you can’t refuse. 🎉  *celebratory dance* So,  dear future colleague , we can’t wait to hear from you! Apply below👇🏽

Can’t find an open position to suit your niche of tech competence? Good thing we just love open applications! We are always looking for new talent to extend our pool of tech professionals. From front-end, backend and full stack to DevOps and delivery leads, cloud and data engineering, from generalists to specialists, our tech team represents talent from all corners of the digital realm. We’d like to hear from you if: You can produce code or script You are a master of something – or a generalist with a broad set of skills – with at least 4 years of experience under your belt You are eligible to work in Finland  You’d like to join our office settings in Turku, Tampere, Helsinki or Seinäjoki or work remotely from anywhere in Finland As a person, you, like other Reaktorians, value sustainability, diversity, and accountability – and an environment in which we all are humans to one another.  Why join us? For two decades, we’ve been developing qualities and capabilities for adapting, reacting, and supporting change – building Reaktor to hold up in a fast-paced environment while ensuring the well-being of our people. Our experts are the foundation of our high-quality client work, and your wellbeing is always our utmost priority. You’ll be supported with internal training and events, development discussions, various hobby clubs, and an altogether comprehensive benefit package. While working at Reaktor, we’ll provide you with:  The freedom to impact how you work. Your team chooses the approach, technologies, and methodologies you think will work best in any given situation. A community with as much support as your heart desires A team that’s not only experienced but considerate as well. Your coworkers are likely as experienced as you are, and they all want you to succeed. A sustainable work-life balance and support for your daily life outside of work (free moving day, moving van & other cars to loan for free, sick child care services, office space to use for your private events, etc.). An opportunity to grow as a professional. We offer +35 internal training events on average every month, +15 community events and several 15-minute coffee breaks to discuss hot topics in tech and design. A possibility to take part in longer academy-like studies like leading a team, delivering challenging projects, Cloud Academy, Mobile Academy, GraphQL Academy, UX Academy, and much more. 300+ hobby clubs from winter swimming and running to knitting and archery that bring people together outside (and sometimes inside) of office hours. Many of these are supported by Reaktor. In addition to our culture perks, we’re offering you an extensive benefit package including the following and more: Extended healthcare services, with broad-spectrum specialist services included Dental care up to 250€/year 300€/year for exercise and relaxation 200€/month lunch benefit on top of your salary Travel and health insurance Company shares Bicycle benefit and commuting benefits Subsidized massages A phone of your choice with a phone subscription Internet subscription of your choice State-of-the-art working equipment you pick yourself A programme to support  Open Source work Freedom to work remotely wherever in Finland full-time, or work up to two months from another EU country Support for possible relocations and help to acquire a residence permit if needed So tell us, potential future colleague: what kind of technology talent do you represent, and what would you like to do at Reaktor? Include your CV or a link to your LinkedIn profile, and a link to a personal website or Github profile, if you wish. Voit lähettää hakemuksesi meille myös suomeksi.  If you have any questions that you would like to ask before sending us your info, you can always drop us a line at  . Note: applications are only accepted through the form below. P.S. Listen to our podcast  . The second season is out now.

Reaktor Creative is a multidisciplinary agency and team of 40+ creatives, designers, strategists, developers, and producers in Helsinki and Amsterdam. We’re on a challenger’s mission: through combining brand, marketing communications and digital product into one offering — and leveraging the brain and muscle of our mothership, Reaktor — we apply a holistic and for-ward thinking perspective to customer experience.   We are looking for a hands-on Design Director or experienced and versatile Strategist, with a proven track record in winning, delivering and leading award-winning work. Do you have the ambition, mindset and set of professional tools required to help shape and grow a design practice?  During the next five years, our mission is to claim a position in the industry as an internationally recognized boutique agency and strategic partner. We’re off to a good start, working with clients such as adidas, Netflix, Carlsberg Group, Oda, QVC, Suunto, Aiven and Polestar — but there’s much more to be done to reach our true ambitions of doing the best work of our lives. Would you like to join us on this journey?  What we're like? In the global context of Reaktorians, we’re part of a ∼700 strong and diverse group of some of the friendliest and most curious people you’ll ever meet. As a community, we pride ourselves on a culture that is open, respectful and empathetic. We work together in hybrid teams assembled to best solve the problem at hand, with creatives working alongside experts ranging from business consulting and product design to content and data.  From within Reaktor’s context of technology and consulting, Reaktor Creative operates at the intersection of marketing communications, brand strategy and design, and digital product and innovation. Our international team consists of T-shaped makers, each with their specialty in delivering as one team, from research and strategy articulation to identity, product, and experience design. Additionally, Reaktor experts in business design, anthropologic research, and technology fluidly complement our teams to design with more sophistication.   In the midst of our fast-paced growth, we’ve learned to keep adapting and push creative boundaries. We have found our success through experimentation and treasure it as an integral part of our philosophy. To continue growing, we believe it’s vital to always create space for new vision, and achieve to be a fertile ground of professional growth for all of our team members.    What we expect from you? You have some accomplishments under your belt and know you’re ready for the next big challenge of your career. The thought of being part of something new and lending a hand to shape it inspires you.  You will be working as part of several teams, focusing on a range of projects and clients with an emphasis on brand design and strategy. As a leader, you carry responsibility for the team and client alike, making sure efforts are purposeful and always collaborative. You love the chase of a good pitch, communicate and inspire effectively, obsess about craft, and identify unique creative concepts with cultural relevance.  As a Design/Strategy Director, you know how to concentrate on what is essential at any given moment, and can guide others in doing the same. You are able to ask the right questions to understand the client’s position and problems, and come up with solutions that benefit all parties – while maintaining creative vision from pitch to delivery. Even with your hands dirty, you never forget to zoom out to look at the bigger picture. You are a designer or strategist with at least 10 years of experience, an impressive portfolio and a professional toolkit that you successfully apply in different kinds of design and strategy projects You master the end-to-end design and production process of identities and experiences, can create compelling visions, and are fluent in communicating and facilitating this vision for your clients You are a solid team worker and treat your fellow team members as your equals Your eyes light up when talking about good design or successful teamwork – whether within your team, to the clients or in public You are fluent in communicating about design both verbally and in visual presentations You are enthusiastic about guiding and helping fellow designers and our community as a whole You consider your colleagues in sales to be your best friends and are happy to open new frontiers with them You have an international mindset and always strive for the highest quality Why would you join us? We are a Creative studio — part of Reaktor — providing modern creative services for forward-thinking clients worldwide, from our offices in Amsterdam, Helsinki, and New York. We help brands to be culturally connected and act purpose first — systematically, strategically, and long-term.  We are passionate about building meaningful brands with creative solutions that solve our client’s business problems with excellence and purpose. As part of Reaktor, we have access to exceptional design and technological competence to serve clients in 360-degree-branding We support work-life balance. We believe that quality in our work comes from a mixture of experience, passion for the job, and a healthy lifestyle. We offer a community of amazing people who you will learn from and will learn from you. If reading this gave you butterflies, we hope you apply. Tell us about your past adventures, and let us know what you’d love to do in the future. Keep it original rather than official.  Send us your application (portfolio and motivation letter included), by 31.3.2022. We’ll be filling the position as soon as we find the perfect candidate.

Are you in your element when moving between frontend and backend? Do you have a passion for solving human problems with a holistic approach? Are you curious to experience a managerless working environment?     Work on various software development tasks building either web or mobile apps   Your daily tasks include: Collaborating with your client's tech and business people: discussing their needs and challenges and trying to figure out what to focus on in the project Coming up with ideas on how to solve the needs technically to best support their business needs Implementing new features that require changes to frontend applications, backend servers, and/or databases. Sometimes even on infrastructure. Other software development related tasks such as debugging, designing, and participating in creating the architecture Based on your wishes, also team-leading or project management related tasks could be added to the mix A curious-minded developer who is comfortable working on both backend and frontend of an app  To thrive in this position, you’ll need:  3+ years of professional web development experience Previous experience with at least one common server-side programming language. Currently, many of our projects are built with TypeScript/JavaScript and Node.js. But, Java/Scala/Kotlin, Clojure, and Python are also used. Strong knowledge of at least one common client-side language and framework. We’re often using TypeScript/JavaScript and React on our web app projects and Swift, Java/Scala/Kotlin, or TypeScript/JavaScript React-native on mobile. Relevant skills to create new backend services and tweak CI/CD pipelines when the project requires Know-how on databases (e.g. PostgreSQL)  Fluency in either English or Finnish and good communication skills (written & spoken) Why join us? For two decades, we’ve been developing qualities and capabilities for adapting, reacting, and supporting change – building Reaktor to hold up in a fast-paced environment while ensuring the well-being of our people. While working at Reaktor, we’ll provide you with:  The freedom to impact how you work. Your team chooses the approach, technologies, and methodologies you think will work best in any given situation. A community with as much support as your heart desires A team that’s not only experienced but considerate as well. Your coworkers are likely as experienced as you are, and they all want you to succeed. A sustainable work-life balance and support for your daily life outside of work. (e.g. free moving day, moving van & other cars to loan for free, sick child care services, office space to use for your private events, etc.). An opportunity to grow as a professional. We offer +35 internal training events on average every month, +15 community events, and several 15-minute coffee breaks to discuss hot topics in tech and design. A possibility to take part in longer academy-like studies like leading a team, delivering challenging projects, Cloud Academy, Mobile Academy, GraphQL Academy, UX Academy, and much more. 300+ hobby clubs from winter swimming and running to knitting and archery that bring people together outside (and sometimes inside) of office hours. Many of these are supported by Reaktor. In addition to our culture perks, we’re offering you an extensive benefit package including the following and more: Extended healthcare services, with broad-spectrum specialist services included Dental care up to 250€/year 300€/year for exercise and relaxation 200€/month lunch benefit on top of your salary Travel and health insurance Company shares Bicycle benefit and commuting benefits Subsidized massages A phone of your choice with a phone subscription Internet subscription of your choice State-of-the-art working equipment you pick yourself A program to support  Open Source work Freedom to work remotely wherever in Finland full-time, or work up to two months from another EU country Support for possible relocations and help to acquire a residence permit if needed Interested? Drop us a line via the form below and introduce yourself.

Reaktor is a team of technology professionals that craft custom digital products and services for diverse industries and clients worldwide. Our teams consist of some of the most talented people within software engineering and product design, and build what others consider unrealistic for industry leading companies such as HBO, Sony Music, adidas, Supercell, and KLM.  We believe in making a change . Recruitment is our most important function, and we take pride in finding the right people to take our company forward and progress our community and culture.  We are looking for a   to help us build and scale our team of world class tech professionals. You will partner closely with our talent growth, sales, marketing, and HR leads, as well as our project teams, to define hiring strategies, building candidate pipelines, and helping us reach our growth goals.  Our culture is based on deep collaboration, high trust, and a lot of autonomy – we’re looking for a person who has deep empathy towards candidates and is excited to evolve our recruitment processes and systems to help us find and hire all the future Reaktorians out there. We hope you care deeply about crafting excellent candidate experiences, and advocate and care for the recruitment candidates throughout their hiring process.  Working as a central part of our operations team, following and predicting hiring needs based on our business situation and growth objectives. Running our talent pipeline, coordinating interviews, and making sure our recruitment efforts are in balance with our business needs. Sourcing candidates from multiple platforms and ensuring we can reach passive candidates, guiding them through the hiring process. Applying your deep knowledge of inclusive hiring practices and improving our recruiting processes to an exceptional, inclusive experience to all candidates. Working closely together with our talent growth lead to continuously improve our recruitment processes and candidate experience. Working closely with our marketing team to define and iterate on our employer branding and recruiting marketing strategies, and helping us build awareness in North America. Attending recruitment events and building relationships in talent communities in our major markets in North America. Leveraging data, analyzing and measuring our recruiting performance and metrics and turning insights into actionable plans for improvement. You care about diversity, equity, and inclusion, and are committed to applying your knowledge and experience to progress us toward a highly inclusive recruitment process. You have a broad understanding of modern hiring practices, with 5+ years of holistic recruitment experience, preferably within technology with a focus on software development and product design roles. You are passionate about combining quantitative and qualitative data to build insights, and you believe in continuous iteration. You think that collaborating closely with everyone involved in recruitment makes great hires, and you believe in good and open communication solving most challenges. You’re excited about responsibility and being able to bring your vision to life. You know how to make things happen and you take pride in your work. A global community of amazing people who you will learn from and will learn from you. Experimentation and continuous improvement of our skills and ways of working. A dedication to constant evolution (and the occasional revolution). A world without rigid hierarchy—we believe big ideas are born when people focus on collaboration over competition. We’re currently working remotely, but our office in NYC’s Flatiron district is open and available if you want to get out of the house. Our preference is that you’re within the New York Metro. We unfortunately cannot offer new visas at this time.  If reading this made you excited, we hope you apply, no matter what your path here was. We hope you can join our community and help us build a company where everyone can feel proud to belong. Tell us about your past adventures in the world of recruitment, and let us know what you’d love to do in the future. Keep it original rather than official.  At Reaktor New York, our benefits and perks evolve with our community, and we're always open to new ideas that will support the wellbeing of Reaktorians. Currently, we offer the following perks:  ⏳ A real work-life balance with 40-hour weeks 🏝 Four weeks of paid vacation 🏖 Floating holiday policy – you can choose which holidays you want to recognize 🐣 16 weeks of fully paid family leave for primary caregivers and up to 8 weeks of fully paid family leave for secondary caregivers 🥰 A community with as much support as your heart desires 😷 Aetna health, dental and vision plans 💰 401K plan with a 6% annual match 🚲 Citi Bike membership and commuting benefits ☎️ A phone of your choice with a phoneline 📚 Quarterly learning stipends to use on your professional development 🖥 Budget for improving your remote work set up during COVID-19 🤩 Dinners, team outings, company trips, and other opportunities to bond with your teammates

. Ajatuksia, inspiraatiota, ja tajunnanräjäyttäviä teknisiä keskusteluja. Uusi jakso joka toinen viikko! Etsimme ohjelmistokehittäjiä ja DevOps-ammattilaisia Reaktorin Seinäjoen toimipisteelle. Olet sopiva yhdistelmä full-stack-ohjelmoijaa ja sysadminia. Ydinosaamistasi on järjestelmien automatisointi ja hallinta. Työssäsi pääset osaksi kokenutta tiimiämme, joka vastaa kehittämiemme palveluiden menestyksekkäästä operoinnista ja hallinnasta, sekä osallistuu mielenkiintoisiin asiakasprojekteihin. Me Reaktorilla olemme ylpeitä erityislaatuisesta kulttuuristamme, joka perustuu avoimuuteen, asiantuntijuuteen ja ihmislähtöisyyteen. Organisaatiomatriisien ja tarpeettoman byrokratian sijaan uskomme vapauden ja vastuun tasapainoon. Meillä on asiantuntijan hyvä olla. Etsimällämme osaajalla on: Lähetä hakemus täyttämällä alla oleva lomake. Reaktor kehittää digitaalisia palveluita ja tulevaisuuden liiketoimintaa. Ratkomme asiakkaiden kinkkisimmätkin ongelmat yhdistämällä strategiasuunnittelua, valmennusta, palvleumuotoilua ja ohjelmistokehitystä. Noin 500 huippuasiantuntijaamme työskentelevät itseohjautuvissa tiimeissä Helsingissä, Turussa, Amsterdamissa, New Yorkissa, Dubaissa ja Tokiossa sijaitsevissa asiakkuuksissa. Asiakkaitamme ovat muun muassa Nasdaq, HBO, Supercell, Kone, Finnair, Yle ja Air France-KLM.   P.S. Kuuntele uusi podcastimme,

We are known for our human approach, have a  5-star Glassdoor rating , and  launched a satellite  running Node.js in low Earth orbit. Our  Lisbon office  is    As a  ,            You can take a look at Reaktor’s initiatives and actions  here  and check out Reaktorians’ thoughts on how the  tech industry could be a better ally to women . 💻 We’ll start with a brief video chat, just to say hi. Here we discuss practicalities and make you an offer we hope you can’t refuse. ❤️ You’re in! So,  dear future colleague , we can’t wait to hear from you! But what really makes us different is our Nordic culture — expect great attention to the work-life balance with a possibility to work flexible hours; high levels of trust and autonomy; and a friendly team of interesting personalities willing to connect beyond work. We believe you know best what helps you grow – be it a certification program, taking a training, participating in a conference or joining one of the numerous Reaktor Communities of Practice – and we are always there to fully support you in your development journey. We are nowhere near the finish line but we are fully committed to taking the journey towards a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace. _values.header: Remote Senior Full Stack Software Engineers
_values.text: We are working remotely and are open to candidates working from anywhere in the US or Canada. Our office in New York's Flatiron district is available for anyone based in NY. Reaktor is a team of technology professionals that craft custom digital products and services for diverse industries and clients worldwide.  We're looking for lead full-stack software engineers to join and lead our teams in delivering world-class digital products for companies such as adidas, ViacomCBS, HBO, Rovio, and Finnair. We need people that are deeply knowledgeable and passionate about technology, are able to consult clients about their core business challenges, and can come up with the right solutions with their teams.  What we can offer you: Small, completely autonomous teams filled with experts in everything from design, to data science, to business consulting, working together with the client to clarify ambiguous requirements, define the best course of action, pick the right tools and technologies, and shape the result — together. A global community of amazing people who you will learn from and will learn from you. Experimentation and continuous improvement of our skills and ways of working. A dedication to constant evolution (and the occasional revolution). A world without rigid hierarchy—we believe big ideas are born when people focus on collaboration over competition. What you'll bring: Ability to make things, and to make things happen. Deep compassion for people—both those around you, and those who will use the products you build. Passion about working on complex problems at any part of the project, from type system nuances to organizational dynamics. Desire to deeply understand the customer’s business to best advise them on how digital initiatives can be used to achieve their business goals A vision and commitment to the future of work: being truly lean and agile and human-centered, and leaving yesterday's pointless rituals behind. Readiness to be responsible for your work, development, and career path. Don't worry: we'll have your back in whatever you want to achieve, but the end goal is yours to define. Substantial working and team leadership experience with concrete results, across different domains and at different scales. We’re not looking for a specific amount of experience, but we’ve found out that it usually takes at least 7 years of working in the field to reach the expected level. If reading this gave you butterflies, we hope you apply, no matter what your path here was. We hope you can join our community and help us build a company where everyone can feel proud to belong. Tell us about your past adventures in the world of software development, and let us know what you'd love to do in the future. Keep it original rather than official. At Reaktor New York, our benefits and perks evolve with our community, and we're always open to new ideas that will support the wellbeing of Reaktorians. Currently, we offer the following perks:  P.S. Listen to our new podcast  . Insight, inspiration, and the most mind-bending technical rabbit holes, brought to you biweekly.

Do you hate repetitive work and think “if it can be documented, it can be automated”?  Do you know how to design and implement continuous integration/delivery pipelines that make application developers smile every time they use git push? Are you looking to work in a software development team with an emphasis on infrastructure and automation? Our award-winning tech community is looking for a (Cloud) DevOps engineer to join our office in Helsinki.  Make sure that cloud infrastructure is well designed and all automation is in place Your daily tasks include:  Working in a software development team with a focus on DevOps work including automating infrastructure, developing tools for application developers and helping application developers with DevOps related work Making sure that automation, monitoring and all associated processes are providing the best possible feedback and ROI to all stakeholders Being a pillar of professionalism who ensures that automation, metrics, logs etc. are easily accessible, especially when the project is handed over For two decades, we’ve been developing qualities and capabilities for adapting, reacting, and supporting change – building Reaktor to hold up in a fast-paced environment while ensuring the well-being of our people. Making sense of our clients’ business challenges and their users’ behavior, and turning your understanding into great designs that benefit them both. Working with our design community to continue building an ambitious, inclusive, and collaborative design culture. Whether your strengths are in unpacking problems, designing immaculate interfaces, talking with users, or anything in between, you have a broad understanding of the gamut of work it takes to build great digital products and fantastic customer experiences. Your natural curiosity about clients, their business challenges, and end-users, and ability to build good, long-lasting relationships with clients. Kokenut valmentajayhteisömme etsii uusia ketteryysvalmentajia Helsinkiin ja Tampereelle. Reaktorin ketteryysvalmentajana autat asiakkaitamme kehittämään toimintatapojaan ja organisaatiotaan.  Reaktor tunnetaan yhtenä Suomen ensimmäisistä ketterien menetelmien soveltajista. Lähes kahden vuosikymmenen aikana olemme työskennelleet noin 2000:ssa ketteriä menetelmiä hyödyntävässä projektissa ja kouluttaneet yli 10 000 Scrum-ammattilaista Suomessa.  Olemme Reaktorilla ylpeitä erityislaatuisesta kulttuuristamme, joka perustuu ihmisläheisyyteen, avoimuuteen ja asiantuntijuuteen. Organisaatiomatriisien ja tarpeettoman byrokratian sijaan meillä on autonomisia huipputiimejä. Mitä tarjoamme Valmentajamme työskentelevät erilaisissa kokoonpanoissa asiakasprojekteiden tarpeiden mukaan. Omaan työnkuvaan voi vaikuttaa, ja tekemisessä korostuu yhdessä oppiminen. Reaktorilla sovelletaan moderneja johtamisen periaatteita ja sinulla on mahdollisuus kehittää niitä vielä eteenpäin.  Tehtäviä, joita valmentajiemme työhön kuuluu: Organisaatioiden, tiimien ja yksilöiden valmentaminen (agile coaching) Koulutustilaisuuksien suunnittelu ja pitäminen Muutoshankkeiden suunnittelu ja toteutus Tilaisuuksien fasilitointi Myynnin tukena toimiminen Valmentajayhteisömme tuntee ketterät menetelmät läpikotaisin teknisine käytäntöineen (esim. Scrum, Kanban, DevOps) ja hyödyntää eri menetelmiä tarpeen mukaan. Autamme asiakkaitamme kehittämään johtamiskäytäntöjään ja konsultoimme heitä organisaatiorakenteen muutoksissa. Erityisalueemme on systeemiajattelun soveltaminen isoihin kompleksisiin muutoshankkeisiin. Ympärillesi saat siis kokeneen valmentajajoukon, jonka tavoitteena on auttaa myös sinua kehittymään ammattilaisena ja valmentajana.  Mitä toivomme sinulta Näkemyksemme on, että muutosta ei voida jalkauttaa antamalla ylimmästä johdosta käsky noudattaa uutta prosessia, vaan siihen liittyy aina paljon tunteita. Siksi edellytämme valmentajilta ihmislähtöisen valmentamisen taitoja, joita ovat esimerkiksi aktiivinen kuuntelu, tunteiden hyväksyminen, tarpeiden huomiointi sekä sosiaalisten tilanteiden lukutaito. Odotamme sinulta myös: Kokemusta teknologiatiimien kanssa toimimisesta.  Huipputason teknologinen konsultointi on Reaktorin ydinliiketoimintaa, minkä vuoksi aiempi kokemus teknologiatiimien kanssa työskentelystä on välttämätöntä. Sujuvaa kielitaitoa suomeksi ja englanniksi.  Valmentajamme työskentelevät sekä paikallisten että kansainvälisten asiakkaidemme kanssa, joten työskentelykieli voi olla kumpi vain. Ymmärrystä siitä, miten toimia osana sosiaalista systeemiä.  On tärkeää, että valmentajamme osaavat tukea rakentavaa epäonnistumisten ja konfliktien käsittelyä. Teknologian, prosessien ja menetelmien lisäksi valmentajamme panostavat luottamukseen, toimivaan työyhteisöön, rohkeuteen ja jopa ilon lisäämiseen. Mikäli tunnistit itsesi kuvauksesta, jätä hakemuksesi alla olevan lomakkeen kautta. Odotamme hakemustasi innolla!

Excited about solving human problems with first-class technologies? Curious about applying your tech skills in meaningful projects for top international clients? Passionate about finding the best ways of working in a global team based across Lisbon, Helsinki, Amsterdam, Stockholm and New York? Look at you sounding like a Reaktorian already 😎 At Reaktor, we help future-thinking companies ( adidas ,  Lego ,  HBO ,  Finavia ,  FC Liverpool , and  others ) succeed in technology. Our Nordic culture defines our key principle: offering exceptional technological competence while deeply caring about the wellbeing of our team-mates. We are known for our human approach, have a  5-star Glassdoor rating , and  launched a satellite  running Node.js in low Earth orbit. Our  Lisbon office  is looking for a   who will become the cornerstone of our new global technology hub of the brightest minds. When you are a Reaktorian, you will be solving juicy digital challenges, sharing expertise, working closely with Reaktor communities in Amsterdam, Stockholm, Helsinki, and connecting with colleagues and clients from all over the world.  Can work with the team to decide the best tools for the job at hand. Sometimes it’s Clojure running in a Kubernetes cluster, and sometimes it’s a small piece of JS running on AWS Lambda. View your colleagues and clients as individuals with their respective strengths and weaknesses. Believe that sometimes tech is best solved with no code at all, but by talking to the right people. Enjoy working with juniors and seniors on the shiny and dirty bits of the codebase. No ivory tower architects here. Are willing to take an active part in shaping the new Lisbon community of the strongest developers. Have a high level of technical confidence and 4+ years of experience. Live in Lisbon or within a comfortable commute range to be able to work from our beautiful office  €40.000 – €79.000 per year. We know that good developers can create great things in any language. For that reason, we see ourselves as technology agnostic and don’t have specific tech requirements. Things we get excited about include: functional programming, Clojure, TypeScript, React, Swift, Kotlin, Postgres and Kanban. We would love to hear about your favourite technologies and see your interest in trying out the others as well. We offer everything you’d expect of an international tech company: interesting projects, competitive salary and an opportunity to go on work stays to Reaktor offices around the globe. But what really makes us different is our Nordic culture — expect great attention to the work-life balance with a possibility to work flexible hours; high levels of trust and autonomy; and a friendly team of interesting personalities willing to connect beyond work. Making sense of our clients’ business challenges and their users’ behavior, and turning your understanding into great designs that benefit them both. Acting as a central part in our small autonomous teams, facilitating ways of working within the team, and making sure the project is efficiently meeting our client's needs. Building and nurturing relationships with our clients’ teams, decision makers, and leadership – helping the client evolve their ways of working along the way and deepening our collaboration. Supporting Reaktor’s growth by contributing to our recruitment and talent growth activities, business efforts, or marketing campaigns. Working with our design community to continue building an ambitious, inclusive, and collaborative design culture. Whether your strengths are in unpacking problems, designing immaculate interfaces, talking with users, or anything in between, you have a broad understanding of the gamut of work it takes to build great digital products and fantastic customer experiences. You’ve seen a range of projects as a designer, with experience from several products from different industries and scales. This may have taken you 6-8+ years of real-world work experience, or maybe you've gotten a lot done in a shorter period. You think that collaborating closely with everyone involved in building the product makes great products, and you believe in good and open communication solving most challenges. Working effectively with your team is something you enjoy putting thought into. You may have explored popular methodologies (keywords: Kanban, Agile, Lean, Scrum) in search of better ways of working. Your natural curiosity about clients, their business challenges, and end-users, and ability to build good, long-lasting relationships with clients. You’re excited about responsibility and being able to shape your career development path, while hopefully teaching your peers a thing or two. We hope you have a vision of what you’d like to achieve, and you feel passionate about being an active participant in the wider Reaktor community. Tell us about your past adventures in the world of design, and let us know what you’d love to do in the future. Keep it original rather than official. At Reaktor New York, our benefits and perks evolve with our community, and we're always open to new ideas that will support the wellbeing of Reaktorians. Currently, we offer the following perks: Reaktor is a team of technology professionals that craft custom digital products and services for diverse industries and clients worldwide. We’re looking for a full-stack product designer to join our crew in delivering world-class digital products for companies such as adidas, ViacomCBS, HBO, Bravo Sierra, Rovio, and Finnair. You will be side-by-side with some of the most talented full-stack engineers in the world in a small autonomous team, working together with our clients to define, design, and build their core digital products. In addition to executing thoughtful features and great interfaces, you will co-create the vision, strategy, and priorities for a product together with the client and your team. We hope you care deeply about creating high impact, high-value concepts and features, and are passionate about building the best product for the problem at hand. We are working remotely and are open to candidates working from anywhere in the US and Canada. Our office in New York's Flatiron district is available for anyone based in NY.  If reading this gave you butterflies, we hope you apply, no matter what your path here was. We hope you can join our community and help us build a company where everyone can feel proud to belong.

Etsimme senior-tason käyttöliittymäkehittäjää modernin, pilvipohjaisen ERP-ohjelmiston kehitystiimiin. Fikuro on nopeasti kasvava SaaS toiminnanohjausjärjestelmä pienten ja keskisuurten yritysten tarpeisiin.Työ tehdään hajautetussa kehitystiimissä, mutta itsenäinen työote on tarpeen tehtävässä menestymiseksi.

Ohjelmistoa kehitetään hyvin ketterästi ja iteratiivisesti. Ohjelmiston laatu varmistetaan kattavilla automaattisilla testeillä. Tiimin työkielenä on englanti, joten hyvä englannin suullinen ja kirjallinen taito on oleellinen tiimin toimivuuden kannalta.

Tehtävän hoitaminen edellyttää hyvää osaamista seuraavista teknologioista: Angular, CSS, HTML ja SCSS. Tehtävä vaatii määrätietoista ja aktiivista asennetta sekä hyviä kommunikointitaitoja.

Työntekijämme ovat ratkaisukeskeisiä, positiivisia sekä yhteisiin tavoitteisiin sitoutuneita. Ohjelmistoala kehittyy nopeasti ja muutokset ovat jatkuvia. Tämä vaatii työntekijöiltä rohkeutta, ketteryyttä sekä uusien asioiden oppimista joka päivä. Tarjoamme ympäristön jossa pääset ohjaamaan tuotteen kehittymistä ja vaikuttamaan oman työsi sisältöön. Monikansallisen Visma Groupin yrittäjähenkinen kulttuuri liiketoimintayksiköissämme luo ainutlaatuisen ilmapiirin ja loistavia tilaisuuksia urakehitykselle. Visma sijoittui suurten yritysten sarjassa kolmannelle sijalle Great Place to Work Finlandin tutkimuksessa.

Jos jaat intohimomme pilvipalveluihin ja moderneihin web-teknologioihin ja sinulta löytyy energiaa onnistua yhdessä pohjolan jännittävimmistä yrityksistä, lähetä hakemus ja CV portaaliimme viipymättä. Työpaikka on vakituinen ja sijaitsee Jyväskylässä, Tampereella, Vaasassa tai Helsingissä.

Tehtävä täytetään heti sopivan henkilön löydyttyä, joten lähetäthän hakemuksesi mahdollisimman pian. 

Mikäli sinulla on kysymyksiä tehtävästä tai työskentelystä Vismalla, olethan yhteydessä: R&D Manager Jussi Seppälä, puh 050 441 6240, sähköposti: jussi.seppala@visma.com   Visma Software Oy on ohjelmistoalan yritys, joka tarjoaa toiminnanohjaus- ja taloushallinto-, matka- ja kululasku- sekä työajanseurantajärjestelmiä pk-yrityksille. Palveluihimme kuuluu myös järjestelmien monipuoliset koulutus- ja ylläpitopalvelut. Visman ohjelmistot ja palvelut sujuvoittavat ja digitalisoivat keskeisiä liiketoimintaprosesseja sekä yrityksissä että julkisella sektorilla. Konserni toimii Pohjois-Euroopan lisäksi Keski- ja Itä-Euroopassa sekä Benelux-maissa. 12 500 työntekijää, 1 000 000 asiakasta ja 1,74 mrd. euron liikevaihto vuonna 2020 tekevät Vismasta yhden Euroopan johtavista ohjelmistoyhtiöistä. www.visma.fi

Do you want to grow and broaden your expertise by working with industry leaders in everything from visionary e-commerce to education, airlines to financial services, and healthcare to the public sector? We value common sense, autonomy and a can-do attitude. We are determined to make our clients shine while we help them to change the world we live in. B e the keeper of the big picture Whatever your craft is, you’ll see things come to life and make an impact on people’s daily lives. You are adaptive and thrive in a role without strict boundaries. You don’t shy away from a diverse range of tasks, as sometimes all of the following may take place in one day. Your daily tasks include:  Guiding the client and team from the current state of things towards a solution. You know how to concentrate on what is essential at any given moment, and can guide others to do the same. You lead by example Working on different levels of abstraction Building and nurture relationships with the team and other stakeholders – helping the client evolve their ways of working Making sense of our clients’ business goals, challenges and their users’ behaviour, and turning your understanding into great designs that benefit them both Flexing your crafts muscles: whether it’s building a functional prototype, pushing pixels in Figma or polishing the finest details of the product demo  Planning, arranging and facilitating workshops when the situation requires Working in small autonomous hybrid teams, facilitating ways of working within the team, and making sure the project meets our client's needs Supporting Reaktor’s growth by contributing to our talent growth activities and business development efforts Nurturing an ambitious, inclusive, and collaborative design culture inside the company A person who can make things and make things happen We’re looking for an empathetic team-player who is driven by positive intent and the principle of charity – and someone who can also embrace change. To thrive in this position, you’ll need:  More than 5 years of experience in designing digital products and services for various domains To take part in strategic discussions when direction needs to be defined To view things holistically and are able to think of a system as a whole, as well as communicate that thinking to other stakeholders and team members To understand and apply modern design practices and processes and to take responsibility for design decisions To enable an effective feedback process, in both giving and receiving feedback  Experience in moving plans into actual execution, knowing when to release and how to weed out the unnecessary Fluency in English Why join us? For two decades, we’ve been developing qualities and capabilities for adapting, reacting, and supporting change – building Reaktor to hold up in a fast-paced environment while ensuring the well-being of our people. While working at Reaktor, we’ll provide you with:  The freedom to impact how you work. Your team chooses the approach, technologies, and methodologies you think will work best in any given situation. A community with as much support as your heart desires A team that’s not only experienced but considerate as well. Your coworkers are likely as experienced as you are, and they all want you to succeed. A sustainable work-life balance and support for your daily life outside of work (free moving day, moving van & other cars to loan for free, sick child care services, office space to use for your private events, etc.). An opportunity to grow as a professional. We offer +35 internal training events on average every month, +15 community events and several 15-minute coffee breaks to discuss hot topics in tech and design. A possibility to take part in longer academy-like studies like leading a team, delivering challenging projects, Cloud Academy, Mobile Academy, GraphQL Academy, UX Academy, and much more. 300+ hobby clubs from winter swimming and running to knitting and archery that bring people together outside (and sometimes inside) of office hours. Many of these are supported by Reaktor. In addition to our culture perks, we’re offering you an extensive benefit package including the following and more: Extended healthcare services, with broad-spectrum specialist services included Dental care up to 250€/year 300€/year for exercise and relaxation 200€/month lunch benefit on top of your salary Travel and health insurance Company shares Bicycle benefit and commuting benefits Subsidized massages A phone of your choice with a phone subscription Internet subscription of your choice State-of-the-art working equipment you pick yourself A programme to support  Open Source work Freedom to work remotely wherever in Finland full-time, or work up to two months from another EU country Support for possible relocations and help to acquire a residence permit if needed Interested? Drop us a line via the form below and introduce yourself.

Do you like working with data and enjoy the process of refining messy and unstructured datasets into something useful? Are you looking for technical challenges related to scale where infrastructure and algorithmic choices have tangible consequences? Are you interested in the field of machine learning and want to communicate and collaborate with both technical and non-technical professionals? Our tech community is looking for a data engineer to join our office in Tampere. Build and design scalable architectures behind data-intensive applications Your daily tasks include: Designing and developing scalable data pipelines in both batch and stream processing settings Working on infrastructure and APIs for storing, transforming and delivering data to end users Working together with our clients and domain experts to figure out their data needs Collaborating with data scientists to design end-to-end data products On your typical day at work you might be creating and building: an end-to-end data pipeline for gathering impression data and serving content recommendations; a semantic search engine for large amounts of textual data; a data lake with numerous data sources; or a platform and data pipelines for running ML models and integrating results to different applications. A data engineer with consulting skills To thrive in this position, you’ll need: A background in working with databases (such as PostgreSQL, DynamoDB, Redshift, BigQuery) A solid programming foundation (for example Python, Java, Javascript/Typescript) Good communication skills and the ability to work with clients to figure out their data needs Fluency in English In addition you preferably have: Experience with at least one cloud provider (AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.) Understanding of infrastructure-as-code practices (such as Terraform, CloudFormation, CDK) General knowledge of modern data science and business intelligence tools and frameworks Why join us? Our experts are the foundation of our high-quality client work, and your wellbeing is always our utmost priority. You’ll be supported with internal training and events, development discussions, various hobby clubs, and an altogether comprehensive benefit package. While working at Reaktor, we’ll provide you with:  Interested? Then use the form below to introduce yourself by sending us your cover letter, resume and a link to a concrete work sample (e.g. GitHub).
